summary: This bill, the Protecting Agricultural Borrower Information Act, aims to strengthen privacy protections for individuals receiving loans and payments from the Farm Service Agency. It amends the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act to prevent the disclosure of applicant/recipient information to special government employees or government employees detailed to the FSA. Exceptions include aggregate data and disclosures with consent (not tied to program participation). Violations carry penalties of fines up to $10,000 and/or imprisonment for up to one year.
